ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Ossicular discontinuity
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: History of head trauma and temporal bone fracture, conductive hearing loss with significant air-bone gaps, hypercompliant (Type Ad) tympanogram, and absent acoustic reflexes.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess the degree, type, and configuration of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
To assess tympanic membrane compliance and middle ear status.
To evaluate the integrity of the acoustic reflex arc.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The right ear exhibits a conductive hearing loss characterized by a slight sensorineural loss at 250 Hz, mild conductive loss in the mid-frequencies, and moderate-to-moderately severe loss in the high frequencies, with significant air-bone gaps. The left ear is within normal limits. Tympanometry reveals a hypercompliant (Type Ad) system in the right ear and a normal (Type A) system in the left. Acoustic reflexes are absent for right ear stimulation and left ear contralateral stimulation, consistent with ossicular discontinuity.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: slight SNHL at 250 Hz, normal at 500 Hz, mild conductive loss 750-4000 Hz, moderate-to-moderately severe 6000-8000 Hz. Left ear: normal hearing.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear SRT 32 dB HL, WRS 96%. Left ear SRT 3 dB HL, WRS 100%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear Type Ad (1.9 mL). Left ear Type A (0.5 mL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Absent for right ear ipsilateral and contralateral stimulation. Left ear ipsilateral present, contralateral absent.

proposed_items: Return for a hearing test after medical management
counseling_actions: Discuss audiometric findings consistent with ossicular discontinuity
Explain the relationship between the head trauma/skull fracture and the hearing loss
Advise on the use of hearing protection to preserve remaining hearing

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is to follow up with the otologist as scheduled for management of the temporal bone fracture and ossicular discontinuity.
